intro: Seridia microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed seridia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or a small tree, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Its small, yellowish flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the warmer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Seridia microcephala is well adapted to dry conditions, with deep roots that help it survive in nutrient-poor soils.
